messages.message:
question for BE, i was wondering if anyone has some input on this endpoint: `api/v2/apps/runs/<jobId>/results`. Is there a way for this endpoint to also include provenance info? Currently, we call this when re-extracting a record in HR, but the provenance data is missing so it won't highlight on the doc again

For v1 `api/v1/flow_binary/results` , we pass in to include provenance info as payload so it works (options: refined_phrases_features: ["provenance_info"])
We should be calling the v1 endpoint, when did we switch to v2?
You should be able to find that endpoint in the Instabase api docs
There is a flag you can specify to have it return confidence scores
according to our codebase it was 7 months ago. Could you link me the api doc? I've never seen it :ty:
Shoot sorry forgot to respond try clicking here
Only public facing apis will have docs and  `/results`  API is one of them

gotcha - i will migrate over to v1. Do you know if there is a bug with v2 (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/get-run-results)? It seems like it replaced provenance with source_coordinates but from my screenshot it didn't give me anything for source_coordinates as well. Maybe it is something for the backlog.
It's a public facing api so I think they wanted everything to be renamed more intuitively
I would just use v1 so that it's consistent
